benchmark_details.name: GeoArena: An Open Platform for Benchmarking Large Vision-Language Models on Worldwide Image Geolocation
benchmark_details.overview: GeoArena is the first live, user-preference-based open platform for evaluating Large Vision-Language Models on image worldwide geolocalization tasks. It collects in-the-wild images from users and uses pairwise human preference evaluations to overcome limitations of existing static benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dynamic and user-centered evaluation framework for large vision-language models in geolocalization tasks.

data.annotation: Collects user-uploaded images, textual instructions, model responses, and human voting outcomes.

methods: Ranking computation via the Bradley-Terry model
methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on user preferences and match outcomes between model responses.
methodology.interpretation: The metrics reflect the model's capability as judged by user responses in a pairwise comparison.
methodology.validation: The robustness of the rankings is verified through confidence intervals of model performance.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User inputs are anonymized to preserve privacy.
